humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The pathology report provides a tumor size of 3.5 cm, which falls within the range for a T2 tumor (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). The report also specifies that there is no in situ component and the tumor is an infiltrating mammary carcinoma with lobular features. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, so the T2 stage is the appropriate classification for this patient's cancer.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The pathologic T stage is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the tumor size is measured to be 3.5 cm. According to the TNM staging system for cancer, a T2 stage is assigned to tumors that are greater than 2 cm in size but not greater than 5 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
